title: Hyphens & Dashes Quiz
description: Hyphens, en dashes, and em dashes each have different jobs. Do you know which to use and when?

questions.question: What is the primary use of a hyphen (-)?
options: To indicate a range of numbers
To join compound words or modifiers

questions.question: Which is correct? 'She is a well-___ woman.'
options: It depends on position in the sentence

questions.question: An em dash is used for ___.
options: Setting off parenthetical information or creating emphasis

questions.question: An en dash is typically used for ___.
Which is correct?
options: My sister in law is visiting.
My sister - in - law is visiting.

questions.question: Should compound modifiers after a noun be hyphenated? 'The woman is well known.'
options: No, hyphens are typically dropped after the noun

questions.question: Which uses an em dash correctly?
options: Both B and C are acceptable
The answer is clear â€” study harder.

questions.question: Which compound adjective needs a hyphen?
Should 'reenter' have a hyphen?
options: Yes: re-enter (to avoid confusion with double 'e')
It should be written as two words: re enter

questions.question: Which prefix usually requires a hyphen?
When should you hyphenate a number?
options: Only compound numbers twenty-one through ninety-nine

questions.question: Which is correct for a range?
options: Both A and C are acceptable

questions.question: An em dash can replace which punctuation marks?
Which is the correct way to write a fraction as words?
How long is each mark, from shortest to longest?
